solution_line_template: The second level has {first_level_spaces} + {second_level_more_than_first} = <<{first_level_spaces}+{second_level_more_than_first}={second_level_spaces}>>{second_level_spaces} parking spaces.
The third level has {second_level_spaces} + {third_level_more_than_second} = <<{second_level_spaces}+{third_level_more_than_second}={third_level_spaces}>>{third_level_spaces} parking spaces.
The fourth level has {third_level_spaces} - {fourth_level_fewer_than_third} = <<{third_level_spaces}-{fourth_level_fewer_than_third}={fourth_level_spaces}>>{fourth_level_spaces} parking spaces.

So the parking garage can accommodate {first_level_spaces} + {second_level_spaces} + {third_level_spaces} + {fourth_level_spaces} = <<{first_level_spaces}+{second_level_spaces}+{third_level_spaces}+{fourth_level_spaces}={total_capacity}>>{total_capacity} cars.
Thus, the parking garage can still accommodate {total_capacity} - {cars_already_parked} = <<{total_capacity}-{cars_already_parked}={remaining_capacity}>>{remaining_capacity} cars.
